item.title: How to check if a user is root
item.description: The following script will use the whoami command to see what user you are. If you are root, it’ll continue running the script. If not, it’ll exist the script telling you that you are not root and need to use sudo. #!/bin/bash owner=$(who am i | awk '{print $1}') if [ "$(whoami)" != 'root' ]; then echo "You don't have permission to run $0 as non-root user. Use sudo" exit 1; fi
